Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Adjuvant Radiotherapy Plus Chemotherapy vs Chemotherapy Alone in Locally Advanced Bladder Cancer

Trial_Design.evidence: Conducted as a randomised phase 2 trial at an academic center

Participants.evidence: Eligibility criteria included age ≤70 years, ≥pT3b, grade 3, or positive nodes, and negative margins post-RC

Intervention.evidence: Interventions were chemotherapy plus RT (2 cycles of gemcitabine and cisplatin before and after RT) versus chemotherapy alone (4 cycles of gemcitabine and cisplatin)

Objective.evidence: This study investigates whether adjuvant radiotherapy (RT) plus chemotherapy enhances locoregional recurrence-free survival (LRFS) compared to chemotherapy alone

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was LRFS over 2 years

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was weighted to expedite accrual

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 120 patients were randomised: 75 to chemotherapy plus RT and 45 to chemotherapy alone

Harms.evidence: RT-associated late grade 3 gastrointestinal adverse effects were observed in 7% of the chemotherapy plus RT group
